page.title: 10History of Pensilva cont'd.
page.content: Mining was carried on for about 50 years, but gradually the mines closed down. Many of the miners emigrated, others worked on farms or quarries. The village slowly declined until the 1960's. Then{more people wanted to own {their own houses and live in the {country.}Several large estates were built, about{250 bungalows}altogether. Many of the new village people worked in Plymouth, others moved here to retire in Cornwall. At the present time the village{population}is again near the{2,000}mark. {Marc Jared Palmer. {Brian Elliott.
